pros: MVRBC offers great benefits some benefits start before 90 days. Co-workers are willing to help as needed. There's never a dull moment each drive is exciting and new. If you like meeting new people and love to travel to different locations daily this job may be for you. The best part is that you are helping the community and saving lives.
cons: If you like a set schedule, this job is not for you. Hours changes from day to day and some drives or super early or the latest can be 9 to 10 pm. However,  most drives are early we don't have a lot of late drives. The only other problem you may run into regarding your schedule is that sometimes you can be scheduled to work late and then you have to turn around and get up the next day at 5 or 6 am.  If you have small children or a busy family lifestyle this may not be for you.

pros: Fantastic insurance and PTO, clean and maintained facilities, respected and known identity
cons: Harassment is not taken seriously (serial harassers are still working while their victims have all left or were forced to leave), whistleblowers are punished (forced out and kept quiet by being paid large sums of money in exchange for signing gag orders), people placed in management who are not suited for the position (too much reorganization, people given very high positions who show not competency in their management of people), conflicts of interest (people made managers while their spouses are given bids for real estate and development), high turnover, abuse of employees (salaried staff being made to work 60+ hours a week plus on-call without any additional pay or time off)

pros: Great leadership and support. Fantastic team environment. Pay is good within the donor relations department. Genuine concern for employees is communicated by the leadership team.
cons: Hours can be extremely long. Schedule fluctuates constantly. If you are working in donor relations you will need to get used to rejection, getting people to donate blood is a lot harder than it sounds.

job_title: Collection Specialist in Cedar Rapids, IA
pros: Loved the mission to help save lives, loved going different places daily.
cons: Local management lacked management skills, very high turnover.  Management had favored staff and if you weren't one of those, look out.

review_title: Great organization for saving lives, not great for employees
pros:
Saving lives by offering world-class blood products.  

PTO adds up quickly and they were pretty good at accepting my time off requests.
cons:
Lots of cons.  I worked in the PMD department.  Hours are horrible, especially on weekends.  Skeleton crew on weekends too.  FT employees are on an "on call" rotation where they make money every day they are on call, even if not utilized.  With how cheap this company is, it would be more beneficial to them to just hire an "on call" driver and not pay overtime AND on call money to an already FT employee.  Too much management for not enough staff; 5 managers for 2 clerks on 1st shift!  And after 5 pm, no one in charge until the next morning (and no one on the weekend either).  NOT the way to run a business.  When I left, they were in the process of driving the management away so the leads could be in charge.  So this way, they don't have to pay them as much as a manager yet have them do managerial work.  

Management didn't want to manage; if there was a problem, the leads had to handle it.  Employees were written up for practically anything and most of the time they were ridiculous reasons (one 3rd shift employee was written up for eating at his station because they found trash in the trash can.  Which, apparently, means he's the only one that uses that).  Leads became exasperated if you didn't catch on to the responsibilities right away.  I seriously would sit in my car and debate if I could call in sick just to not have to deal with all of the toxicity of the environment.

Our job was to not create reports, our job was to bill and ship products out.  But we had multiple duties that went above and beyond our job title, with of course, no mention of additional pay.

pros: Decent pay for a part time job. Perfect for college students. Very friendly management staff.
cons: Petty high school drama among other hubs and PMD clerks. Too much crybaby and telling on each other.

pros: Pay is decent and benefits are good.
cons: It was like working in a high school. They target out weak links and nice people and try to force them out of the job. They also typically form small groups to gang up on people for no reason. It was nearly impossible to get the motivation to go to work. It was one of the most immature environments I've ever had to work in. I was NEVER happy.

pros: I really enjoy the people at work; we're all friends here. I work in IMD as a driver.  All the management are good positive people; a good atmosphere. Nobody complains about the benefits (pretty good).
cons: Being on-call can be cumbersome.
